title: Man 'who put toddler in hot oven burns another child with boiling water'
text:
Terry May reportedly hurled boiling water over a three year-old boy less than two years after he was accused of putting a three year-old girl in an oven (Pictures: Volusia County Sheriff’s Office)

An alleged child abuser notorious for reportedly putting a toddler in a hot oven has now poured boiling water down another child’s back, police say.

Terry May, 47, is said to have deliberately scalded the three year-old boy late last month after the youngster accidentally wet himself at a house in Deltona, Florida.

His injuries were spotted by teachers, who reported them to Volusia County Sheriff’s Office.

A report said the burn covered half the boy’s back and ‘ran from the very top of his back all the way to the bottom.’

The youngster’s mother reportedly blamed the mark on the boy being pulled across the top of a trampoline.

Another photo of a burn inflicted on a toddler Terry May is said to have put in an oven. Sheriff’s deputies ultimately chose not to pursue those charges (Picture: Volusia County Sheriff’s Office)

But the boy himself told deputies a different story, saying: ‘My back hurts. Terry burned me.’

The youngster’s relationship to May has not been outlined.

He is now living with relatives under the supervision of the Florida Department of Children and Families.

May now faces a charge of child abuse causing greater bodily harm, the Miami Herald reported.

He hit the headlines in January 2018 after alleged shoving a three year-old child into an oven and turning it on.

The horrific incident left that girl suffering nasty burns on her foot and ear, with investigators shocked when she told them she’d been put in the oven.

That saw May branded ‘SCUMBAG of the week’ by Volusia County Sheriff Mike Chitwood.

But prosecutors later revealed that they’d been unable to prosecute that case, leaving May free to allegedly abuse another child.

His bond has been set at $250,000.
description: Terry May reportedly scalded the boy after he accidentally urinated on a floor. Last year May was unsuccessfully charged with putting another toddler in a hot oven
